Generation VII.Sun: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
Generation VII.Moon: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don't groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.

Generation VIII.Sword: It throws one knifelike feather after another at its enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak point. These feathers are known as blade quills. *
Generation VIII.Shield: It never slacks when it comes to the task of cleaning its feathers. Thorough preening keeps it looking spiffy and its blade quills nice and sharp. *
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.

Generation IX.Scarlet: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don’t groom it diligently, it may stop listening to you.
Generation IX.Violet: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.

Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Coronet Highlands : Space-time distortions (after completing Mission 18), massive mass outbreaks (after completing Request 102)
